About me

About me

Hi, my name is Hossein Feiz and I live in Montreal, Canada.

Montreal.

Projects

Take a look at this Projects page to get an overview of my current work.

Favorite Topics

I’m very interested in shell scripting, Python Development, Electrical Machine Desing and Data Science in general. I love exploring Github, Stackoverflow or Python and improving my skills everyday.

Additionally I love building Deep Learning models with different open-source packages like Pytorch and TensorFlow

Skills

Here is a list of subjects I’ve worked with, grouped by topics…

Scripting and Programming Languages

Bash • Python • C# • LaTeX • SQL

Operating Systems

MacOS • Ubuntu • CentOS

Cloud Orchestration and Automation

DVC, Docker, Kubeflow, Kubernetes

Packages and Softwares

Active Directory • File Server • Web Server (IIS and Apache) • DBs (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis) • Python (Numpy, Pandas, Pytorch, Scikit-learn, OpenCV, …) • Unity (ML-Unity)

General Software

git • Unity • VSCode • Pytorch • OpenCV • SQL •

Experience

2018 - 2020 Tor Vergata as SysOp / BigData Engineer

2019-2020   I was studying machine learning, cloud computing (Docker, AWS, GCP), Deep learning in our program at Tor Vergata University Rome.

2018-2019   After finishing my study I started working at Engineering365 located in Rome. I was responsible for developing Deep learning techniques for NILM( Non Instrusive Load Monitoring) project.

2017 - 2018 FARA as Python Developer / DevOps Engineer

I was working as a python developer for programming Raspberry-Pi kits. The aim of the project was using accessible instruments for home automation.

2014 - 2017 Sun-Air Research Institute (SARI) as Electrical Engineer

At the Air and Solar Research Institure I was responsible for Designing Electrical Machine for Wind Turbines, Finite Element Analysis of Electrical Machines and Designing Electrical Drive for Generators.

Education

I have a bachelor and master degree in Electrical Engineer. I recently graduated from master level II in DataScience. Currently, I am a PhD student in Deep Learning.
